Posts.Content: Hi,   I am sorry to hear of your friends challenges with cancer. I cannot give you advice but I can say that miracles happen and that she is lucky that you are her friend.  I cannot imagine having toI deal with these types of medical complications and surgeries. We are all here for you. I wish you the strength and courage that you need and I wish your friend the love and peace that she needs right now to deal with whatever she needs to.  Becky
Posts.Title: mets to other organs

Posts.Content: Hi, I was diagnosed in 1996 had chemo and then took tomoxifen  for 5 years. I was given nothing for the next four years at whcih time I had a reoccurence. I was then put back on chemo and then arimidex after two years of that I was taken off of Arimidex because I then had another  baby tumor grow up they then put me on avastin and now just aromasin.  So, the best I can tell you is they do what they can but I would make sure you engage in learning how to live with it not die with it.   The side effects of arimidex are not fun and no one  seems to get that it is not just pain...it is PAIN. I am doing better on aromasin. The pain is less.   I hope this helps in some small way. Hang in there.  I do not have mets anyhere but one small spot on the lining of my lung.  B
Posts.Title: Recurrance

Posts.Content: Hi,  I am on Arimidex and I am just 48 years old. Yes, I experience pain but it is not getting in the way of my life or preventing me from activitities at all. It seems to be controling the growth of my tumours as my blood test are getting better and better and my last scans showed a dramatic decrease in the tomour size.  It is your call but I would rather live in minmal pain than shoot the dice.   Becky
Posts.Title: arimidex~side effects

Posts.Content: Ok, call me crazy I am starting the Avastin treatment with Aromasin tomorrow. I have stage four cancer I have one lone star tumor on the lining of my left lung, the doctor is trying to kill the little bugger and not me. Is anyone out there doing this besides me? I cannot even find women in my shoes. I was 9 years clean and was struck again two years ago, so 11 years  fighting thus far. I have had chemo twice once in 1996 and again in 2005. I am now 48 years old. Becky
Posts.Title: Avastin and Aromasin

Posts.Content: I had my first treatemnt today...we will see how it goes!!  Thanks for the support!!! I will keep you posted.  Becky
Posts.Title: Avastin and Aromasin

Posts.Content: Hi,   I am two years out too and I am on Arimidex and yes I have back pain accross the middle of my back near my bra line. I do not wear bras anymore because of it. Have you ever heard the saying sick and tired of being sick and tired? I am tired of complaining....it is  now one day at a time one foot in front of the other.  Good luck with it and hang in there. Becky
Posts.Title: Arimidex and back pain

Posts.Content: Hi,   Is anyone out there who has survived this at stage IV for more than the statistical five years? I am about at the half way mark and I do not intend on checking out anytime soon. I would sure like everyone out there to know that you can survive this illness. I am  almost 12 years out of my first diagnosis which was stage two and then 9 years later stage IV and again 11 years alter again stage IV. Just let me know that you are there for those of us needing to know you can make it this far.  To all of you that tell us to get prepared!!!! Think again!!!! You get prepared!!!! HERE I AM!   BELIEVE IT !!!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: Stage iv second time and 12 years later

Posts.Content: Hi,  I was treated with chemo the last time I was diagnosed and Arimidex afterwards.. Chemo and Armidex was working it killied the tumours so it seemed but another spot appeared on the lining of my lung so they put me on Avastin and Aromasin and I have been getting Avastin every two weeks since January of this year. I am due for new scans soon to see if it is working. Ask your doctor about Avastin treatment it is supposed to be a very good new drug.
Posts.Title: Stage iv second time and 12 years later
